title: SES Q&A | Leveling up multi-orbit connectivity
summary: SES is looking at other options to consolidate the space industry after merger talks with Intelsat broke down. SpaceNews interviewed newly appointed SES CEO Ruy Pinto as the multi-orbit operator prepares to receive billions of dollars in C-band clearing proceeds.

title: Rapid Starlink iteration poses challenges for resellers
summary: SpaceX’s ability to quickly change and update services has been awkward for resellers, an executive for the low Earth orbit broadband constellation said Sep. 13.

title: European Industry Could Generate €9.9 Billion From Crewed Launch
summary:
A PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) study found that European industry could generate between €5.9 and €9.9 billion between 2028 and 2040 by developing and operating a crewed space launch capability. The Socio-Economic Elements of European Human Space Transportation (HST) study was commissioned by the European Space Agency and completed in December 2022. In addition to finding that […]
The post European Industry Could Generate €9.9 Billion From Crewed Launch appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Space Force to release guidelines for the use of commercial satellite services
summary: U.S. Chief of Space Operations Gen. Chance Saltzman said the Space Force is finalizing a blueprint for how it will integrate commercial satellite services into military activities.

title: A NASA astronaut will finally spend a full year in space
summary: "I'm really excited to see how my body does when I return."
